intro: Atriplex pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir saltbush, is a perennial shrub native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are adapted to arid and saline environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to harsh climatic conditions. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, dry fruits containing seeds. Atriplex pamirica plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is sometimes used in phytoremediation due to its ability to tolerate heavy metals.
